member.summary: Returns the Web site that is associated with the URL that is used in an constructor.
member.returns: An object that represents the Web site.

member.summary: Returns the Web site with the specified GUID.
member.param: A GUID that specifies which Web site to return.
member.returns: An object that represents the Web site.
member.exception: Throws a when a Web site with the specified GUID could not be found.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPSite.OpenWeb(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the Web site that is located at the specified server-relative or site-relative URL.
member.param: A string that contains either the server-relative or site-relative URL of the Web site. A server-relative URL begins with a forward slash ("/"), while a site-relative URL does not begin with a forward slash.
member.returns: An object that represents the Web site.
member.remarks: This method emulates . If a web site with the specified URL could not be found, returns a "non-existent" .

member.name: T:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection
member.summary: The emulator of .

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Creates an object with the specified website-relative URL.
member.param: A string that specifies the URL for the new website. If the object represents the websites within a site collection, the URL is server-relative and begins with a forward slash (for example, "/sites/MySitecollection/MyNewWebSite"). If the SPWebCollection object represents the child websites directly beneath a website, the URL is relative to the website and does not begin with a forward slash (for example, "MyNewWebSite").
member.returns: An object that represents the web site.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the website with the specified website-relative URL from the collection.
member.param: A string that contains the website URL relative to the root website in the site collection. For example, if the website to delete is located at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/DeleteSubsite, specify DeleteSubsite, or if it is located at http://MyServer/sites/MySiteCollection/Subsite/DeleteSubsite, specify Subsite/DeleteSubsite.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection.Item(System.Guid)
member.summary: Gets the website with the specified GUID from the collection.
member.param: A that identifies the website.
member.returns: An object that represents the element.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the website with the specified site-relative URL from the collection
member.param: A string that contains the site-relative URL.
member.returns: An object that represents the website.
member.remarks: If the specified does not point to an existing website, this property returns a an object with the property set to false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SharePoint.Emulators.EmSPWebCollection.Names
member.summary: Gets an array that contains the site-relative URLs of all the Web sites in the collection.

member.summary: Determine whether the current process is running under 32 bit native/emulation mode Since Microsoft.Sharepoint.Emulators.csproj is compiled under .NET framework 3.5, we cannot use Environment.Is64BitOperatingSystem.
